subject: Happiness Tips for Valentine‚Äôs Day Season from Dr. Laurie Santos
snippet: Hello class, If you enjoyed learning about the science of happiness in this course, I have more research-backed insights to share ‚Äî this time, about love and relationships. A new season of The
body:
Hello class,


If you enjoyed learning about the science of happiness in this course, I 
have more research-backed insights to share ‚Äî this time, about love and 
relationships.


A new season of The Happiness Lab is here. Think of my podcast as an audio 
extension of what you've been learning in this course with the same 
research-backed insights and practical strategies to keep you up-to-date 
with the science of happiness.


You've learned in this course that we're often wrong about what makes us 
happy. Turns out, we're just as wrong about how love works.


Listen to The Happiness Lab
<https://eventing.coursera.org/redirect/P0Zf_M8zTdft_ImrvV-hh-4XY2bjcO3rII2vmImwqLn7uf4r6ZK18W4MtvFr6Gg0FKG6zonb7udM7119eh1nTA.C5TiUSk6g0wrHnK7-lJvhg.pJvR3wElxuHAK25PI8WXCTEGqfGMBVFwTP5U7dPTInoybQnMWBZuQhZ3iK6EAeBFZm1S259WZQJsIAg4_N2IN5zxFn_CJj9Eebpvi9iWxgTzh17Oc9FVHUNhZu2b1s26aV5jwHz5s017hXplN_NSGEw505yhbyonAQqZNIoZPS0MyM-i3cqHHv7qLPcuyXL_sf_VHzTqEgxbUerE3xiyEsTjwkXqI-L6i0Bg81Wp-6ApjBMQx1Zwqq9w4glJlupI44Z14vNu15tF-PRwcVvWctGSYk6F4IDVKF3hcnpQi7TGuNRemUUH8lOwAdPTcnqQstDwlnV8toO8zKvDJtWdia5xMk9J9clsmHtAR_2gg1WRMLdEmFd3y4ydouqobfxKoi5aUjlffnVBusFVL0s_LOBqX6-XW4fUwfCS8Dj1tVJZ3vnQbOVA1hBu0r0d7Qamu4i879X8u5TIii6FuDg72Tu-8y_qLefmur3R5jD55vtk6cuBLKtwXzNtOrxF6L0EaF7mcQde7ez5T9KaMV1VJpQQsuEHwYLYymSSHyIIJ40dLmhKwKyVgrOKV1qMPt1MC9dMR4voB-bdvZYpCWqT5TTIsMAwgj4FU9DOrPjk8A5pDmRJbmQJFZSJxKE7HbZpbMT-mZ0ATrfx_J_2BVmvG-X84MWgn78YXnZwq3VzGJsOXTg7rGNBeblRYWNEuGB2ZBSCv053kz6CjWEpCMghr6hgmPdq6Sg22tJwV6JULm0> 
free wherever you get your podcasts. (And if you didn't know I had a 
podcast, this season will be a good place to start.)


Want more practical happiness strategies in your inbox? Sign up for my free 
newsletter
<https://eventing.coursera.org/redirect/b8QJ3KKeNQAIX82n1AG6VkeJT1NXw7uHmYxZQekBwDgXTx-veeJCLhJg_nw0gLP73c9zv2H4x9ED5Shtyqe51Q.PQzq4nsaB6Sq3cuP59hDiQ._ta7SF901gdr_n2u_d7gqjCf_ztO9303VwSVsUXARMDTBUpkxResimADun4XRB189Ad8l59CA-iyWaERk_SgAAV3zKPDjedGFImRVYyZDcTyqpbLe0PrvDuPwUYCjSSP8n6iQcA1q7Zj6gL6oGBz2kDOGT5viL6Hbw4CobSOqwQmxAH7rbOWa25I-Mbsf2VQIROJ3dyawP0qf63QZnoCeXdsB6vIwo59ZdNILKhNFa4c8dM2iLzrpqWFYU48V1l_h4ntr8llrZe_g_RqEevUmFOCVGa1PRJBclU28b9BDxUwtS7vslIWvfXQI17OUJodHL3FzHIKmbl2vLP9DqyrSNRHqcDeMhTT0hgeIywmR6oh_NhscBLm_fiEnK6veMgkJyQ_zwWXv-5WBXesvuacdvxOzHKY_XOiAl6voDY7ENESKGRioEyHIDDX9vXtqZ6rOKHFFQHR0uPaV5JQyjs4zOucLEd-SzXJO8aTJAF_N_fTVfmcfhUt1v_7cAhaKGWSPrqsYyqMf8l5y42T4-8kg0nfmMNj0bScMagkTkBJ1jwckRFcQn9prKV5aogydWqm19W9y3Cqw-3eG7-q03XlhD0KahQ4J9EPDeFCbdmp0QZW3Oyriw_prEEEjgFGlJau7Ms1LjlrrtrvkAcs44cvUtJRJnbNIw8BHQuJ2VpKnlE-2sjz-HgGXIxw_gtJecUp> 
to continue your well-being journey beyond this course. If you enjoy these 
Coursera updates, you'll love getting weekly insights on the science of 
happiness delivered straight to your inbox.


Happy Valentine's Day!


Laurie


PS. Know someone who could use better strategies for love and connection? 
Please forward this their way!

subject: Love is in the air and so are rewards. ‚ù§Ô∏è
snippet: Hey there, Love is in the air and we have something special for you. This Valentine season, complete simple tasks in Rewards Hub and earn up to ‚Ç±143 direct rewards on your everyday transactions and
body:
Hey there,

Love is in the air and we have something special for you.

This Valentine season, complete simple tasks in Rewards Hub and earn up to ‚Ç±143 direct rewards on your everyday transactions and crypto converts.

What you can earn from:

* Completing KYC
* Depositing and holding funds
* Paying with QRPH
* Converting PHP to USDT/USDC

Stackable rewards available until Feb 28.

Open the app and start earning today.

Go to Rewards Hub ( https://click.mail.coins.ph/click?ZTFJtb6IwHPezkOCrcSsFCzUhdxTwYTJkbjPON6RALUUE5UFvXu67X9i5bH3T9N9f8nv6e8dMFJzVtE6bqq1-8QMVRU85cP5IB2ksIQOxNKW6QhECiq6PEgUn0FAg0g0MTcAA3Ul3UiKNVc3AQAN3UiuNVQAxAhBjzTRVUwMjcCd1qjQeqabxd_D66bm3mVSibH4cs3tWKsfsPi4qfl-zSy9IybpYEY0S02Q_eO6VRR_o6JhFS2fizZfBIiB-MAl8hzj-4jEgi-XCJxOf-Dc1A_-sDk4_OU0_Q1CH_SOhhyMVvBSpBTUAdIhMbBhDHtdUpBaw-3Pat_ZZ0XYKSsDzmmyMFZ9RUm5SzbkOeVKI1HJysHCehG3U7iPJnNxezRt76pLOczZ7x2_UzWzH3Zjjp2a1rmx8Ii5BU3Od5B2g8bYi8A0-ZGiC2kLZPbxSW2yunu1foktCvjd3ZnX1vT3Wh_ExSKqyZWVr9Xdd3WY3c9aaFqxsRclkaDQyBAG7NAVrW1bLEEwEbWUIIIBIhuBrY75Aw542EqmlajpQMYYj3UQIoZFmov9_SVWerZfrfDkfXYgZTlulahq6RDjYPrua7hKyfZ-d58UBz4F3irpX9xCGzPfy8rBHTqevPBjGeRtteR6HLFZeQi3P1vpsM5tN3eqNiXf1-rBimfn0e6qHXXHkXNZcWXMHnL6h3L_8GwA7p5ab2fd06 )

subject: [Action Advised] Review Google Cloud credential security best practices
snippet: Secure service account and API keys to prevent unauthorized access. MY CONSOLE Hello Phil Gerard, We're writing to provide you with security best practices regarding the management of service
body:
Secure service account and API keys to prevent unauthorized access.




MY CONSOLE




Hello Phil Gerard,

We're writing to provide you with security best practices regarding the  
management of service account keys and API keys within your Google Cloud  
environment.

Recent security trends indicate that long-lived credentials without proper  
security best practices remain a top security risk for unauthorized access.  
To ensure your environment remains secure, and to modernize your  
authentication strategy, we strongly advise implementing the unified  
security framework outlined below.

What you need to do

Action advised:

Secure the credential lifecycle: Apply standard security hygiene by  
following these best practices:


Zero-Code Storage: Never commit keys to source code or version control. Use  
Secret Manager to inject credentials at runtime.
Disable Dormant Keys: Audit your active keys and decommission any that show  
no activity over the last 30 days.
Enforce API Restrictions: Never leave an API key unrestricted. Limit keys  
to specific APIs (eg, Maps Java Script only) and apply environmental  
restrictions (IP addresses, HTTP referrers, or bundle IDs).
Apply Least Privilege: Never give full permissions to a service account.  
Use the IAM recommender to prune unused permissions for service accounts,  
ensuring only the absolute minimum access required for their function.
Mandatory Rotation: Implement the iam.serviceAccountKeyExpiryHours policy  
to enforce a maximum lifespan for all user-managed service account keys. If  
service account keys are not needed, implement  
iam.managed.disableServiceAccountKeyCreation to disable the creation of new  
service account keys.

Improve operational safeguards: Ensure a rapid response to security  
incidents by completing the following:


Set Essential Contacts: Verify that your Essential Contacts are up to date  
to ensure critical security notifications reach the right people during an  
incident.
Set Billing Anomaly and Budget Alerts: Ensure billing anomaly and budget  
alerts notifications are acted on. A sudden spike in consumption is often  
the first indicator of a compromised credential.

We're here to help

We are committed to helping you maintain a secure environment. If you have  
any questions or require assistance, please contact Google Cloud Support.

Thanks for choosing Google Cloud.





‚Äì The Google Cloud Team





DOCUMENTATION



SUPPORT




Was this information helpful?

Yes Neutral No


¬© 2026 Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

You've received this mandatory service announcement to update you about  
important changes to Google Cloud or your account.



Visit Google Cloud blog Visit GCP on GitHub Visit Google Cloud on LinkedIn  
Visit Google Cloud on Twitter

subject: Explore Machine Learning in Healthcare, Statistics, and More with Stanford Online
snippet: Are you a healthcare professional looking to advance your skills, or are you passionate about increasing your personal health and wellness expertise? From executives to team leaders to curious learners
body:
Are you a healthcare professional looking to advance your skills, or are 
you passionate about increasing your personal health and wellness 
expertise? 


From executives to team leaders to curious learners at home, Stanford 
Medicine offers a variety of online courses and programs
<https://eventing.coursera.org/redirect/Ee1Pxh-RS47Ktr73aITBvC0H1tLkbD5obbJCqFoD_fu0cejO7Pafkbo6AlwtvTivJZv5pv9QkwuTpBAzkHL86w.CfXpQXj6MIiXt5Err8aDcA.z20Xd0Gz5YNSTVJ5oderBk-V3sT-X_EpqMgCnP2_OK_y4IZj1K65b4nmCTHEpIxaw3SyARmYzEw5l3oAqSyL9o718oaGsGKsZq99u66BG5DY9zdUu_oR7-oMx-SuT0ZVi7Iwk01OfjWuHUcWpVxHeUrWfPOpHx_96hqf-hhzi36jmMOBkf-5_4CzhZLbCLDvi54tN3xvuKj7G5nurYL0FZX9Lb3BRqXnbz_5rMUQs4Guqo3sU5M-iy0l6r3dKH3J8hDcLyk56pxTO85_bObHlzCPxkMdXoB-xP0B6d-fNgCNQdLDR_5_CUvKEby49ytv_Vj0L4-F47AbaYFSO2tsYxwmwL9nNJ1lQJyk7VbkJ_NybPs9ZSqWBxb2Bo1K0kbg8VjLl4MewpnFjOAsJbkKugozdxEDbVyDamBSXm9SRy0_jMD9EzYFtpMrQom19iQ9tEl8zuOV7XIL0CMIdebulTsDXMwBmuVCnI_j4LixGtGuwGc7to7402FZBm4ciKTpyvFBXDv9u6Fj_F8GjKRntb9tl4CxgrBGXVhkt4u0VW675Tc7e90vDiMkMWOgAku4-ZGk61IGiRqYOBa2q6b2iuHjw3tgL0ZtXzySEin0aemlq341v6h2z0CL4wzKbjVLoDvD2LLpAqrckjrmrI2C1nP0XR0ceqqcM1dh8Foqj1g> 
designed to fit your learning goals, budget, and schedule. Our courses are 
taught by renowned Stanford faculty and cover a wide range of topics, 
including genetics, biomedical data science, AI in healthcare, nutrition, 
epidemiology, addiction and more. 


Featured: Applications of Machine Learning Program Preview


Explore Applications of Machine Learning in Medicine, a two-course Stanford 
Medicine program led by Dr. Nigam Shah, Professor at Stanford University 
and Chief Data Scientist for Stanford Health Care. This program will take 
you from healthcare data foundations to responsible model development and 
deployment.


You can now get a sneak peek with our free program preview to see if the 
program is right for you before you enroll. If you‚Äôre a clinician, 
researcher, or health data professional ready to build reliable, clinically 
meaningful AI solutions, this is your next step. Enroll for Free >>
<https://eventing.coursera.org/redirect/RLTpUIWE9VtmoI7quOvkz_kBST9dA1G5uh2i4Lgcs3yalLCej3JvuAAgGCaB2HITSqSyXbAKtLSjIbK_-BanwQ.4mTW1xBFAxWt7A9BXDcV4g.nW1J-0O1PhQlvXKyjw2KsqxoNdPKqZvnJ1-UzGS4ImhKbE444yrhB8KZR1r252pC7mb0dzpfSaF6CodNqefVJypItNlUMsHQoBoI5HTuexCAa_4PKt8k_HIHzodiWshmTt56mbFnRxwxswHoLC_vDFkP8um53_iUsvWtZbBOtqi7WsyosoGbHvc39EG7aJwKr-xSPP78SRSlTzpU8bCLnDkcUm2BYXZ7nmPokXhrtSMUVg8LnIw8_yN7OyvKWhez7PyD-r9ZWQCzmPKItq5GscNynHBxa3i51nR_HPt0frVtNYKPDd7w4zkTovbRbI6rjpuxYH6katWSWaI451NZy8y0YTeVi_X143nHxpcHI_hHEzBxWDHqGXwh8bZkfZ2-UDYXI-8mfPnOYAbjyAd7XVxwv6aMNxzNOk4n3BxQqczYvz3mBdvUlvrZsHcmF7zciD0DV2cVgwPIx9cSJW0XR6L--bDykFdG0Za3890uOmPafEiBnKgwBgTjwo36xfMM3a-BswuOkZwPvc-V6JWOV-NnYyJXlg6-OU2Pvm7iR15xSShOi7wTNv3-RuS8MxpUVcxODs_iYtPCtKuPlWR0AljY7kKUjpbFYNdCt5ChK80drbsfEhjdzusHBb3mpC3ZMlNKJpGxZwn6X2qZ9o2ywj3qY-aWJW9ExOOPIxjK0w_J3mPrWGZlepg6Ne97Q1hYpHTT-0Xk7RIU77LohxlXbg>


Two Genetics Programs to Choose From: Foundations of Genetics and Genomics 
and Applied Genetics and Genomics


Learn genetics from the leaders shaping precision health. Start with 
Foundations
<https://eventing.coursera.org/redirect/3b9rXHGDww0RhWBBcp6MMAgP76Sf91lz7Us3xTVLZ8DOmEAUL42BbHL2HKnC3d-mYx-4KOHt0vHge75mNBXgMw.zboo64NwOrqIMVGOvxzBNg.vnoc7wyvLsLRO-Bl7ut6dF2WmC-vJIAJcLOdp8tlW4S1J9Kew8RgKqN-2yw6Ss6zWJTKrMGx2hA8ZecV87NJt1Cff6YQXuQAkYBdr95GT2WxygNk8-DQZ6JKGrJgYp2o1inaPougdj1Qoywz1NuQPhoY6F4DtwKxFmQOqjbTN8S7AuyYYFooVDOoZzXoxhdH8cnmi-ybF_OuCjHH9gGlbBdLOPKLM9HzcK17_XR4_DDxeq3jMfA7XKQoYxrNBVbDF0eG3A8WXOMR8Qs85kC8rYluH9QyU2HbEZkJyEGh4ISjQi1C0dFgtx_jFKUpVvSjVbb2II60ZDVNdelyGoxlAoqGXL7--OTcox2y4eoZWcKXKXQKNeWNAoak5WneNOk7vygSVTyaQ0zQXoS5xZYGIQisBXWB4fV3v9EqnsaJO9Vy51E2rDic1nJ7uVZRJ15Oz4xvquLNpDJ6MKJMvlA0cSiKdTdfis5ze6Kez6SO-boIUjs1ARdt_QFoOR1qQNtnm0bA9XRKDRFQYlPFifYFE9h0Kx0fOujZ7j3rCYaxmwp0UnLEpJy1CnN-ZZDyLPQ-evanD2ABnFHT5gmyFCqx7Kp1srKsCt4m_LxDRRZrgDxxbxwDdUsj-vAG9pH4ytdAetazUtaXwUyDZ2WHI-Eyb0Y9RpHfvxPT5gDctEUfRHRdb4Ty7w0BuDuHfe3HmxIO> 
to master core concepts, then level up to Applied
<https://eventing.coursera.org/redirect/rirmsdDsWJwcfMHSB8nrRW4kYrfunzCexrkf23Pyeoim8Zuu8YL7bqIUDkipSMuJ5oR2xRLPGWzHVdP_5P-Tew.pecx8kHjinVg3N7gqI5nwQ.k-8Al5-inCFSwvAjFkrTrhRqIsQV1ZU6bqZDkKZHrzY1Kot3s0ta-g7BzzaXYpvfH_iy4ruU9Yr3GKwQIf1AIPhi9F_BTvN0zmqNu6gU2cVZagFE9Sk9ckqA9aDx9a8tNeQADTlLt8626Tn_PGie1JwUSBMKI0t81WznBpPmvsCsOOLI6VvZjScxPnazUpm-5ZLkVBErMgbDEZNaR5dfyBeUsUGCt5ahsU720IA1vezzq8z4Yt71kX5JOA-Q_87gYVteLDiEp935VUWAZC2zA1jOx8cUC5fCYVn8jXkguX_wdFP7tm0PD5y_GZ38VYanyPgYC4SC526dCk1JyKXJfgGFiVmF81z236bQtQpHGOx6jq8NmMvHJiVu9dyXpgvJXW_c2YIt1uFxPjEj39H2jy49_BiJKX-EgsKme_UXN_rdkOh1VZ6Fd2GUstFG0k_x9Bgd0PAngJKOr2XwHB4HgNOffoAf7lUlqiB-GDNX-1c9psccNPblgNnMQKXyBVbm7mcAtG6oYtBx7vTmf8yELAlebMOCqIVgoSHl73ZjkkeCEHOzYYZNGNRZMoriEKPr5VFQM6SKjDCZLRRFyTWUfSuMLi5CclA8D5hA5h8vPHT6Dd8kf4AG6De1vo_3IP4oTd1IDJ7Q1DH67TcUzrN9NTLDKlOmd08ALm4AkrIomQ4> 
to tackle real-world cases. Study online on your schedule with Stanford

Started >>
<https://eventing.coursera.org/redirect/Zh0pGo4OjY0oMdHaukCjaeamxGtDzrCeBMhPkCnMLUEeaEeFWOa2L5_xdKflm7rgcMdBQX4GnjIKkwC_li2oKw.WTM34WkkyKhlXPVI9Rpu7A.axEwG3tmoWIw27neJgNR45bfpbhIzcy38GqtZ2a5G-nu4xxzVIkN_ulWLnN-VB5dt07atvOppL8bxlmv-YrB-wewA2kP8z38C_ZW7GrUINrZjcC6bHCuYS0AX_SMTBuThJzd0LscvsP53MQwc_tLPPEYUgdVlc7T2Za_50tK1ULOdd3xsRUe4mba97V32wjY_onRWZBYM5-DkyNy5-_85KGPqpWD-EYmWdLTQz3ibLJuYtAF2fmu9cjYvvC-f2zppAk6OxKiq30kcDnbG8y7-H6fCeUpe7_rz0L9SfN9paqlG789DbfyE8QkvSIl_O975_YXMNCLEMey4Jd3KCuGJvpOLk8hd_uBbgoMGHfA0RRCahgRwn5UjUCIWZmRQBTxTGJ_aYv0fYcweH6J9IzB0jMruFDR7e8XmkrZ4MGHTOlGbgmzesh8XAQuMO0B7lHFU_VK_-5wHEBUig13iQSYZTfmxL4HAwMQ3y6vFm3tm3eA-BAUQA5oquBWrhWq_TXuEAiYEItrfeUlVzskYmTlTdd39YUxrFXa6Qlipyg3h711IE3-K0wZC6XnSNP15j6cw8d0t0n7CKo17sXODiMfc48dOcucaLghxl0c3Sv7xmiDwfhDQBJWJmcfyid6bmzj8gjXtm0tnSenvDmx1dYumSuFUdZCiQdqtVKe6h_lqGPMBe8Q_s_pofHHI82_pkGu>


Course: Demystifying Data: A Modern Approach to Statistical Understanding 


In today‚Äôs data-driven world, understanding statistics is more crucial than 
ever‚Äîbut how can you begin to make sense of it all? 


Experience a fresh take on statistics through this course‚Äôs practical, 
concept-first approach focused on interpreting data and results with 
confidence. Through engaging stories from healthcare, business, government, 
education, social science, and psychology, you‚Äôll learn to clean and 
interpret data, navigate the controversies of public opinion polling, and 
more. Learn More and Enroll >>

subject: Comedian and writer Ilana Glazer joins Harvard Professor Todd Rogers‚Äô newest course
snippet: Learn to communicate with confidence in Effective Writing for Greater Impact Ilaza Glazer and Todd Rogers Make every word work harder for you. Every email you send, pitch you share, and presentation
body:
Harvard Online
 

 Make every word work harder for you.

 Every email you send, pitch you share, and presentation you deliver is an opportunity to influence what happens next. Your writing can either create confusion or move people to action.

 

 Led by Harvard Professor Todd Rogers and featuring insights from comedian and writer Ilana Glazer, Effective Writing for Greater Impact is designed to help you write clearly, concisely, and persuasively in any professional context.

Enroll Now
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 



You’ll learn how to identify your communication goals, strip away unnecessary information, and make your writing more relevant, engaging, and easy to understand for any audience. Through practical examples and exercises, you’ll practice crafting goal-driven, action-oriented messages that help you get faster decisions, stronger buy-in, and better results at work.


By the end of the course, you’ll have a toolkit you can use to sharpen your writing across emails, pitches, presentations, briefs, and more—plus greater confidence in your ability to communicate with impact.




Start Today
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 

 Build your Power Skills for Career Growth Certificate of Completion
 Complete any five courses included in Power Skills for Career Growth within 18 months to earn your Certificate of Completion.

 

 These focused, fast-paced courses are developed by leading Harvard faculty and brought to life with insights from award-winning celebrities including Cynthia Erivo, Amy Poehler, Michael B. Jordan and more. They will help you build the power skills, confidence, and high performance mindset you need to thrive at work and in your career.
 
Learn More
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 

 Partner with Harvard Online
 Group enrollment options are available! Designed for all career levels, these courses strengthen professional skills, accelerate skills development, and help employees at every stage embrace a growth mindset.

 

 Fill out the form on this page
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 to learn more and inquire now!
 
Learn More
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 

 
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 
All rights reserved.

     You are receiving this because you registered for one of our courses or signed up to receive emails.
 
Harvard Online

     114 Mount Auburn Street Cambridge, MA, 02138, US
 
View in Your Browser
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
¬†Manage Preferences
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?%3D

https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?%3D

subject: Join actor and wrestler John Cena in Harvard Faculty Dr. Luana Marques‚Äôs newest course
snippet: Gain strategies for overcoming challenges at work in Building a Winning Mindset The Harvard Online logo Luana Marques and John Cena Turn workplace stress into strength. Stress. Uncertainty. Constant
body:
Harvard Online
 

 Turn workplace stress into strength.

 Stress. Uncertainty. Constant change. You can‚Äôt eliminate them from your work, but you can change how you respond.

 

 Taught by Harvard Medical School faculty Dr. Luana Marques and featuring insights from actor and wrestler John Cena, Building a Winning Mindset: Flexibility and Resiliency at Work is designed to help you develop the psychological tools to stay grounded, adaptable, and effective under pressure.

Enroll Now
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 



Guided by Dr. Marques’s research and her in-depth conversations with John Cena, you’ll explore techniques for adapting to change, tackling the tasks you’re most likely to avoid, and channeling your emotions into productive action instead of getting stuck.


Throughout the course, you’ll reflect on your own workplace challenges and define a personal vision of what it means for you to truly thrive at work—then build a plan to move toward it with resilience and confidence.


If you’re ready to stop just “getting through” stressful situations and start growing stronger because of them, this course is for you.




Start Today
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 

 Build your Power Skills for Career Growth Certificate of Completion
 Complete any five courses included in Power Skills for Career Growth within 18 months to earn your Certificate of Completion.

 

 These focused, fast-paced courses are developed by leading Harvard faculty and brought to life with insights from award-winning celebrities including Cynthia Erivo, Amy Poehler, Michael B. Jordan and more. They will help you build the power skills, confidence, and high performance mindset you need to thrive at work and in your career.
 
Learn More
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 

 Partner with Harvard Online
 Group enrollment options are available! Designed for all career levels, these courses strengthen professional skills, accelerate skills development, and help employees at every stage embrace a growth mindset.

 

 Fill out the form on this page
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 to learn more and inquire now!
 
Learn More
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 

 
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 
https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?
 
All rights reserved.

     You are receiving this because you registered for one of our courses or signed up to receive emails.
 
Harvard Online

     114 Mount Auburn Street Cambridge, MA, 02138, US
 
View in Your Browser

https://click.mail.harvardonline.harvard.edu/?%3D

subject: [Product Update] Automatic enablement of new OpenTelemetry ingestion API
snippet: We're enabling a new OTLP ingestion API starting Mar 23, 2026. MY CONSOLE Hello Phil Gerard, You may have previously received a notification regarding this update. If so, please disregard this
body:
Hello Phil Gerard,

We‚Äôre writing to let you know that Cloud Observability has launched a new  
OpenTelemetry (OTel) ingestion API[1] that supports native OpenTelemetry  
Protocol (OTLP) logs, trace spans, and metrics. Starting March 4, 2026,  
this API will be added as a dependency for the current Cloud Logging, Cloud  
Trace, and Cloud Monitoring ingestion APIs. This change ensures a seamless  
transition as collection tools migrate to this new unified endpoint.

What you need to know

Key changes:

    - The existing Cloud Observability ingestion APIs  
(logging.googleapis.com, cloudtrace.googleapis.com, and  
monitoring.googleapis.com) are automatically activated when you create a  
Google Cloud project using the Google Cloud console or gcloud CLI. The  
behavior remains unchanged for projects created via API, which do not have  
these ingestion APIs enabled by default. Starting March 4, 2026, the new  
OTel ingestion endpoint telemetry.googleapis.com will automatically  
activate when any of these specified APIs are enabled.
    - In addition, we will automatically enable this new endpoint for all  
existing projects that already have current ingestion APIs active.

What you need to do

No action is required from you for this API enablement change, and there  
will be no disruption to your existing services. You may disable the API at  
any time by following these instructions[2].

Refer to the attachment for a list of the projects that will automatically  
enable the new endpoint

We‚Äôre here to help

If you have any questions or require assistance, please contact Google  
Cloud Support[3].

Thanks for choosing Google Cloud Observability.

‚Äì The Google Cloud Team

[1]  
https://docs.cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/reference/telemetry/overview
[2] https://docs.cloud.google.com/service-usage/docs/enable-disable
[3] https://support.google.com/

¬© 2026 Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

You‚Äôve received this mandatory service announcement to update you about  
important changes to Google Cloud or your account.

subject: Big Tech‚Äôs tobacco moment
snippet: The social media trials will determine if Section 230 can save Big Tech View in browser February 10th, 2026 // Did someone forward you this newsletter? Sign up to receive your own copy here. Big
body:
The social media trials will determine if Section 230 can save Big Tech

View in browser (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRv2-6q8W8wLKSR6lZ3phW75RhDb6jTc16W5743Zz5tH6lSW1JJrly7gZhZTW8gsB-8451HtrW2JXKXS4yM7DGN5s25ztrYyKzW3x5Cvd6qsR33N6hB2tDKw4-tW8bv3TD1-pkLPW8qNq6k5gDpv0M2rZxDDQ64fW91fyL96vckcmW5k5P2g98-3k9W5gX8Ny3m8ffMN3XPp09jjXCbW7mSqK-8jFGNfW7m5RfZ7Mc9SVVDK63X3G4ghzW1kbwhT37hXRjW1xnykb1hg469W4gTt3y6rnZQcVkS5zd1_3w0lW98M4lK3_-cjlW60cqF783cXf5W6xD20c3f_PNyW3xblNP2_vHKNW2d8N6n345Q73W6qPdQZ26J9vTf4d6pPC04 )

February 10th, 2026 // Did someone forward you this newsletter? Sign up to receive your own copy here. (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LPK2-6q8W50kgx26lZ3pDMPMsncHr1FZW1ZjKYK2nKDh3W3Xvlzx7tFzV_VSlTBn3T4jShW7szvGl5-rgY2W7lt8TN2xk3m3W6VsBZm7kyz_bW8CK2625k42P-W2p_W168ksR43W2mFJ7M8ynWX0W5d6Q6b84F-XCW5gv74T50Q6p0N7y1hQBYh5FhW2Z6Qpv1T1cqYN3NB3DJyPs08W4nHnLZ1SHM83f8PdqdC04 )

Big Tech‚Äôs tobacco moment

This is Big Tech‚Äôs tobacco moment.

In the 1990s, the tobacco industry took a major public hit when internal documents were released showing that executives knew their products were harmful despite testifying to Congress (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3lBW58CGh_41XfYXW2sD2028PvlmDN5kvWMsV4W4XW865_WH7_12GGVlwyZF6zJ16RW30GxQm39m0h9W1l2vw051dByzW9lKl57297yPbW1ZL7Kw6Zpr64W2p_m1_1dsJV7W7lRpGd14DpFwW6RNPpP6jsqPLW2VYbWP4pt_VqW3yz_6q2tW1Q5W4BlGlG6pC1RKW7jDCdF7dSZJ1W3VHHBz7JsGyKW4jFznf8b0ZTSW3wJD5Z9bdCgtVzLg353ZxXNmW4Nh_6k2lz59cVQjs696f_Qv1f2xSNWH04 ) that nicotine wasn‚Äôt addictive.

Nearly three decades later, we are watching a similar story play out with Big Tech, right down to the smoking gun, as internal documents at Meta reveal they knew their platforms were addictive.

An historic trial (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQW2-6q8W7lCdLW6lZ3nHVgLjDC1lmTTmW2k_Nyg425NhDW2pH86Z75v5m8W9l-_7K1S69JyN5-QzGf-fNWCW4Dld-352vYqBW1Q82Ym1HRgx-W4m7CZR14jbKMV5cH_s5TX7TYW2rP8Ws4YDxnZW4VKX9R2GV-drW1TgLgD6R32LqVP9f411_KRSXMdM2_Q8lVbNW7BKVGS813C_7VSzT5J5cPdyhW2p_VR04pS4M_W8gWMWb3Gn2YlW3jblhJ7Yc0fVW8kbjP73X7RX3W8g6GPb2fFy0zVbmBY65jxrnyW8zpLWg6QGYPNW2pC0zn9jtwRwf324ZzC04 ) began late last month in California, where a jury will decide whether social media companies can be held liable for harming minors. The lawsuit targets the platforms themselves as defective products, arguing that their design and architecture have caused harm, not the content on the platforms.

This is a novel approach that bypasses Section 230, a 1996 law that has shielded Big Tech from liability.

In this newsletter, we analyze recent tech lawsuits and how their outcomes will shape the future of Big Tech, tech policy, and the everyday experience of internet users worldwide.

// Social media on trial

On January 27th, jury selection began in K.G.M v. Meta (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3nrW7c4kfC3rlQFkW90qKBd80V2GSV-jXHV15vvvcW61HKDW7yLf-XW2bdg0m7_HRpLW4wD2nq4t1PfTW5Xvgll2M5ZSMW4lV0zH5By0C2W2lkfx24yPwK7N6dWSD_WYwfDF25w1kvFc6FVpLdnt2XXc3bW6smFvg3fRzgJVnWX6g7gGWBpW6VqJ2P4q8NGsN1P2gtQmwJ5wW8Nfvz360wShyW4MKCv01XRwwbW2QF8Mw2P90t7W1k6h2f7c63QSW208Z7l7th_8wW4GxLrT1ksMQCf2PJNmF04 ) and YouTube (Google) at the Los Angeles Superior Court. This is the first in a series of bellwether trials in 2026, representing over 1,000 lawsuits from families, school districts, and state attorneys general.

K.G.M, the 19-year-old plaintiff from California, is seeking damages for addiction-related mental health issues. Her testimony will detail how the compulsion to use social media led to anxiety, disordered eating, and body dysmorphia.

-

For the first time, a jury, not a judge or a private settlement, will decide whether social media platforms deliberately harmed minors.

-

K.G.M‚Äôs case is part of a larger group of plaintiffs seeking guardrails (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQW2-6q8W7lCdLW6lZ3ptW2tgJYG7kS27jW2Hddcn22y6-SW8Tm_Jm8nhqDzN9j4vDj1nkQtW5PVkCS8xgKy_W10mk4g1zSZDmN3wFmWKxhMJ0N20hnFnpd6YnW4Yh-kB6t959xW1_T-402hg4p_W2F_62n2FXSfwW3lbTCp280qWZW3g0YNG1ln94qVMZZ8d2P1RK7W1lZxG72PqQJ6W1GdVm08R0k9hW5RFVHF96Q4vTW1QwJbm4Q3m7kVJydv46wrZvpN8Lf7jPcBWNXW5nNdLt4XRyHrW7p3RPq7SyWXLW4F2NBF4hs4PNW7tBN3H39N1Y4f9h4WSl04 ) against addictive features, prominent safety warnings, and stronger age restrictions. Two more individual trials are scheduled for later this year (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQj2-6q8W69sMD-6lZ3ljW6vStkt9l1TKNW2dBSMZ49KGzGN14sv1JLXR9GW2WKNWq89brXLW4b7dxC1zgCvzW67LVGJ3QlHQKN2cSxrhG0WrvVpJ3Lg81zg1SW4280nB8shNtNVScWcY88G9wMN2h-nYqt3YnHVxCDhB61lBXmW3VJLSp8cM73cW6z_bCH5SCwr8N6kQXxJ69t1PW6WfY8659rb13W3fBSPS7kY2sqW8J39GF8jsqKsW28DZdV1_z8sGW3WBKy01jsjG_f8N8yX604 ) in Los Angeles.

-

Mark Zuckerberg and Instagram‚Äôs Adam Mosseri (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LPK6XcqxW50l5tj6lZ3pBW9cCbBM2p572qV9b-yf2cgt0WW3Qdyvr5dPcFlW8CpcZX1hwQ54W1xTLHR8VJMRPW7ztcT98lky_qW4cSpg17ZVvd7W8bjY098smYGdW5TXKTN8hXxwpW3-yKST1XDxsSN1-m0ZckvKpgW46hMKz6-87p-N14dWRSj2lVKW2jmsxp5PjgZxW4kyVRs4M63t8W4gMjTQ6Yb3--W6Y7-CQ24Sz3hW3d4Cbn403_p1N8yVHnVvymlCN17ZYf2FvJytW1sZVMl27fwRFW50hwPc94W9hTW1kBfD-1LsNvZN2hSMmXGxTT3W6D1P585XbsgTV-xgZX50ntbmN4n7K-bDMQfTW8xBFDQ70NSFZW21n_H58TqwwPW2_zdsN2q52RdW32l7Ql4hmkkyW5xvlXp95ynv3W5W8mKt3lQ-wFW7VKtHG4ncSQcVcmVRs5fpDNCW59lrSD4_y5hGVWrt4l2F_TZMW7mWNWn1bC7g7W6byx1d6yK5kjVsnZtp4DTKVtW6Xn-0Z5jjYHlW1ss-Mc75JnQgVtbClz5YcQ6RW8JkL6C8HDvnSVMLNsR4Wl2T-W2wnjZR6bb914W1Hc6Sl7RjS9yN6x7Ly-JfxRgdsvkcv04 ) are set to testify, and YouTube CEO Neal Mohan (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3pYW27zbjn40LwcrW2ZHVZv8QXw-NW1G480W61tVgFN3lwKQ7-1PBgW3k47n7400BgtW4LN2BD2Q7fLvW6RHQBd1gj2h8W6bkBdT8h-v_WW3f87qd4qgPqBW4bb-Sm7GHgDQW3l702Y4m_QlbVZkSxl79V78dN2RypTLjBbBGW8Lq2Tj5lPYS9W4wJWNw55VFFFN8xrkfF6mhmqW3PYtM85qdtzFW4qVc5k8YVHJgW16TjLb2fP_gMW31t-212HfgsyW67fl875W-zm4W1l_ggs2Z2582f6qVjdW04 ) may also be called to the stand. Meta and Google‚Äôs defense teams had previously sought to bar expert testimony, but a judge ruled in the plaintiff‚Äôs favor. A verdict is expected in March.

-

TikTok (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3mhW3SN0Jv6YTPxbVD96DV67TrhcW2wlr-77gdSkmW3_flqB6P_3k8W2qlBbH5D8MD1W4lw6dN7WT1F0Vsj2X_7xHPGVW72j1pq2WYcmdW61sl-Y7Fn6QkW5hPyLv460QHMN9dz8XStTwGMV25TJQ2nYbVxW7CmG6t1zrWcBW8LZk345mGSJYW43Rd3n2XrcWgW5KMzw27Zgq58W8tcYCQ8T-5T4W6nG5Yr8BVD0jW929mhV7tJCdrW3P0Bbp15B-zyN6PrYh8VDS5dW35xh3q6fHdfVf9hTyDq04 ) and Snapchat were originally defendants, but both settled (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQW2-6q8W7lCdLW6lZ3lfW2P0VLq7_WtRtW1vBQVZ8vL_44W45F-386lMYtcW2YWYfn8YD8dyW99jGlr2v6jY8W5pRpGt4p9h73W54xtj01CjFFkW6HB6D_2JWRLyW8nHH6q6xZLTkW7Jh3Yj4jQDdyW20z3_x2FQR97V9JBvj4_Ry5NW1HfNLg5Sg0rVW5v-b333bf0cMW2cVtdt3d9ghKW7-PYb37Vk2w9W3kW2p16xZ2XQW20rTS82kSzGMW2sFCwn2DRzdPW4-jPw77BBLbPW8kmsDl66_WvGW7fJrJY3Nv1MQW6K0Nw64WchvBW6jLS3w6mTp_xf2wDhBl04 ) before the trial.

Matthew Bergman, an attorney of the Social Media Victims Law Center, a Project Liberty Alliance member, who represents K.G.M, described (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3k-W2yckNj2VXTYjVNXB-q6-_nPNW58QKf81PJKvxW8q-1hv8hZPg0W8p0x3C1P5M-sVKkytH8FRQcXW6bTKTK1VrVYgW4hdFzj62P-F1W8GQcNl2R0zcwW8-1Y1w4zlP2JW3vMW3G6Yvt71Vt_8r88498mRW7d4r2p3VtFr2W3ctLMH6JMw3LW2Y-7K15NyNlrW8nKD-m7TqM4zW8WsQ5H2P0B9HW5xfS5S3lxFdSW6nxw8g4bWcXsW3K-wCX5C7R9CW3mqfCg4QdrWgN4jlqMTv9ZF9f84BL2W04 ) the stakes:

//

‚ÄúThe public is going to know for the first time what social media companies have done to prioritize their profits over the safety of our kids.‚Äù

//

// Further litigation

In addition to the trials in Los Angeles, a federal court in Oakland heard arguments in over 1,000 lawsuits filed by state attorneys general, school districts, and families seeking damages (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRv2-6q8W8wLKSR6lZ3lrW4Q5wfx7TfrgdW9jNPTN7HJ7TSVjTWQG3RMbfVW12QrLT1qb_dbW5tCNhy47tj7TW66_yWK3_c66ZW3yQ06v3Ssg3lW7W4Zp85BzwCNN9gY5gxqrkk5W7Z8q8R5sMyYRW4F4mBm1J14w5VLTjtM21vBMGW4mbltX98tw00W7dD_Jb6gnBWcN69rHrq1WWNrW3nLSxx1H40PKW2NSwf_3MLFc5W4FwC9L8hF8XCW6wG_tK7Jx8PfW77f9S58hJ7xyMSj-C5xNnsvW2lFLlG5NM9-zW2qB8v_5f1t66W5H_5vC4wnSKtW6w6vlw10z4BXW5qv0pL8RmKHqW8FyMCW4pMbVZN2m9WbpfvKJ5f64dVrP04 ) for harms arising from platform design.

Separately, 200 school districts have sued under "public nuisance" claims, arguing that social media platforms cost them resources for counseling and mental health screening.

These cases (with trials set for June) could prove successful, as school districts secured a $1.2 billion settlement against the e-cigarette maker JUUL (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRv2-6q8W8wLKSR6lZ3nKW8QQ3rL118CkrW6t9__H4gk9X7W18V3LP7fDVrVW94gM444PMMvcW6nk4G65cHZLJW49V4L43XKLP5L4jzYv7Cy4MNQn_n33DjgW6PFSw8361qV4W6jnysy8F9bDwW74BdCc2f2FZkW5X-CTr4sf0T0W7PpXnj3Ml0rHW4wx-M995SJlRN2XrGRWn7Yh3W5tdDfP705z8RW2TDHVZ5FFD33M2YsYlVbQBdW7jzLfp6H56bjW25X78z4_tQfmW4MnYYK6fsHfnN6B97WXGf6yGW6y67s54mNv9ZW6SVrgl62ytkqW1h4vyC3D5XFkW5Grkb85Pm1bBN4pJz9dTvpjlW1q0bfQ6r-8Zkf2fkFvn04 .) , also under ‚Äúpublic nuisance‚Äù claims.

// The "smoking gun" evidence

Recently unsealed documents (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3pmV96P7q1ZTQjzW2Mp_Kt1wMpStVXcZG73H-8P_W80wgC58QKktYVjpb6q2cZJgsW78GFNm8GKSyyW5L1zn564kD-cW1SQRJT1qFF92VwT0q-33zJp9MqNWkTqGjnyW2Bh5ld2hhKH1W65glgZ2JjcfyW8_Jvj14_-PdxW4LdTNM6FjpQtW2YBJ5R3SpFf8W2Yq7w-5CcgMSW4TQndt2Kmh2mW23nS8q1NYnSNV6TFkK3S6XnmN6x3fvbfFqXRN9cVqG0h5RqcW4b5jyX71vRJkf30D1G204 ) illustrate the many ways in which Big Tech has knowingly centered its business model around teen addiction despite explicit harms.

-

The most damning internal documentation features Meta‚Äôs very own research. The company launched Project Mercury in 2020, research that was eventually buried from the public (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRv2-6q8W8wLKSR6lZ3k_W4lcCdv5MgBWCW7fdkCL2F4g_LV23GDH8CKYNhW5Rm0Fd30CT41W6MlDzJ5-M8HkW11q5FM3r_ygqN6-4pNGR7-zrW8kGW1r5sbqrcV6dFXs4sTs9SW5pvFYT5FlrP7W7DmS5D7HxryVN7s1B0pR0JD9W34SjCY7JVtzQW27dgLQ3Nc3gwW70RwcH46sMmMW8xq0NX4LLcH8W2lG4Wp2H6mh4W2CXdsb5DzSZcW8v-xFQ5_whThW5bWB9D527Tx8W4Lptlt28DkYrW909Xlq72wK71W3vC7jh6vMzLBW80N33T3X-3T8W7PF67d5mdP1ZW1pNcXc5lfSx8W3rBBtF6X9pqqW49fLR734YmlsdSSffK04 ) because it openly admitted to the harms caused by its design choices. The research indicated that users who took breaks from social media showed declining rates of anxiety, depression, and loneliness. An employee warned that burying the results would be repeating history, ‚Äúlike tobacco companies doing research and knowing cigs were bad.‚Äù

-

Internal employee conversations about Instagram addiction likened it to a drug (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRv2-6q8W8wLKSR6lZ3mfW2CdDfF3KPcWTW4DqmcM5XVSDSW6tD7552ZcTndW907wVt5n-p3PW51jKcJ5rC85RW8RwT1J7rxgqkW1YFnyt7dybpNW5CSnnL2JHP4jW72wGlH6rm1fmW7Z8dVc33K86xW2QxYf-8M1GtWW43hL1_46ZGVJN3FhpXSm9kt9W5c_ZxR6jKFQfW3p0KGB2QwkrLW98JrNq1_Z7x6W72XW3J5M1DvLN2sZM6gJqw05W6lHbrr46v1mSW3GCdbW8kdkcDW2NyJJ18yQrLwW4r-4Sy1tCchJN2nJbm5bKMQ5W2d4VWd3dBZGCW3GWKWP1ytNGFW7brWj96wXBgKW1V7ld3208CxHVJ8cp93q5s6qf5PZ16j04 ) : ‚Äúoh my gosh yall IG is a drug‚Ä¶We‚Äôre basically pushers,‚Äù one Meta researcher wrote.

-

A 2017 email from Mark Zuckerberg confirmed that Meta‚Äôs target market was teens, and internal communications at Meta assessed that ‚Äúthe lifetime value of a 13 y/o teen [to be] roughly $270 per teen.‚Äù

-

Google also targeted teens with its Shorts content. An internal slide deck (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3pmV96P7q1ZTQjzW2Mp_Kt1wMpStVXcZG73H-8P_W80wgC58QKktYVjpb6q2cZJgsW78GFNm8GKSyyW5L1zn564kD-cW1SQRJT1qFF92VwT0q-33zJp9MqNWkTqGjnyW2Bh5ld2hhKH1W65glgZ2JjcfyW8_Jvj14_-PdxW4LdTNM6FjpQtW2YBJ5R3SpFf8W2Yq7w-5CcgMSW4TQndt2Kmh2mW23nS8q1NYnSNV6TFkK3S6XnmN6x3fvbfFqXRN9cVqG0h5RqcW4b5jyX71vRJkf30D1G204 ) described the ‚Äúnegative well-being effects can result from user behaviors,‚Äù and how researchers ‚Äúfeel that [YouTube] is built with the intention of being addictive. Designed with tricks to encourage binge-watching (i.e., autoplay, recommendations, etc.).‚Äù

Casey Mock, Senior Policy Advisor to Jonathan Haidt and the national movement behind The Anxious Generation (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHW5n2LPp4J-x8NV1J0Lf8N1KSSW7BdYvc1hQXVrW5dfyC17JTGSXW519nYj3pQx3QW38-R-j53HPHDN4tZPpB4G3V_VYP_Mm1DqS7rW8fSlT91LKPvRN84HxFmLDGSXN53k71n9gtpwW8RsP_x2wQ_T_W3LH-fF5J7ZmsW6bsvSL4yFyfKW1xh4rt4HlGvVW5whvcT56gw6y23v2 ) , wrote an article in After Babel (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LPK2-6q8W50kgx26lZ3mNW5fxZG170K77MW4jp9cc1fBm_LW8V9hQl1KVM5zW5gcQT36g8xfkV7w_xP7l6MxRW30pj961wPQVzW1jXf041wCgZQW6-CZ2w1j76pvW6V6kS435-gSWW4ljyLv1Qq-r4W7Q0QV92vz03dW7ZQ4Rj9b77BXW3bK5l750jHFCW2rR_nM3wdzyGW5q-8md85StJ_N942SqcDQmW9f1ZZd9l04 ) that traces how ‚ÄúMeta's lawyers have perfected a playbook of deceit first developed by Big Tobacco‚Äîand why ending the era of tech impunity means holding accountable the professionals providing the shield.‚Äù

// Big Tech‚Äôs defense

‚Äã

With damning admissions like those from internal documents, what legal leg can Big Tech stand on? Their defense centers on a few claims:

- There is no clinical definition of social media addiction (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRb2-6q8W7Y8-PT6lZ3q7W614hTC3zsh1bW5ZkVSP5gnPg9W1XXFL21ZQbt9W8qvs2r36J1whN7QBNwwRyq7RW17ncLV14Zw9CW7zSgzF1nVYP6W1RQPtk55b7kCW8Qy3p561BMDZW8lBkx-7tY1kQVwQ5Bx4RJsvxW1jL53D8sB6ncW5BtsCb5ffPctVM_YgW30NJmtN8vXJJ_-SCf8W6-qKY56rgdhxW8KCMt85dvHb5V7mYk12V8LS6W7XQm808SDc_GW62frll51G6kbW7s6Jd02WftRrW8WYKbR51CTvGW7G0wbd3pJB53W70D6k92hPgwHW70NmJn6MNrwXW47MwL-6S0fMmf83sqg404 ) , and while there might be a correlation, there is no definitive causal link between social media use and mental health issues.
- Guardrails already exist, including parental controls, age verification, screen limits, and terms of use documents.
- The features challenged in the lawsuit are editorial choices, not part of a defective product design, and Section 230 should extend to these allegations.
- There are other factors shaping teens' mental well-being that cannot be attributed to using these platforms.

// Challenging the legal armor of Section 230

The key differentiator from previous legal battles is the shift from content liability to product liability.

These cases argue that the platforms have manufactured defective products through addictive design choices, including infinite scroll, autoplay, push notifications, and recommendation algorithms. These product features are what have caused harm, rather than the content on the platforms.

Some courts have begun to accept the distinction (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRb2-6q8W7Y8-PT6lZ3mNW4dF5HH61Jm0wW7DsW3Y349nfVW7hLvh76QjzfPN7k34N4NMFwLW57LrXC7sq-z-W8PLx1x9bFmWnW3Bzcf74lcSDqVHK97y1n6P-DW7r3phX9g55wcW591v0360rc7RVfsdBm43dpz3W2Wg4J789TLSrW4PbP1z2p4kdwW7tVcYy4jcqmYW1f05R67dc7XFN2ZQ9cw68nymW1FSCNf2sGq1PW2cXjqg4DxdF2W82cpRd453hNFW41fpC_92L60QN2j-3NMlSp1RW4Vt3_82nl5y1W2K2gHG2w0-3yW6GDcT373hz1kW8S9tn_7Qx65MW2JzBYD9g5Qssf2MsNXK04 ) .

- In Neville v. Snap, an ongoing lawsuit concerning fentanyl overdose deaths (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3p0W63B68M1Lfbg7W4vb09F90qRkWW1t28MP6Thj8CW7wVfy53SB0C1W7r38Vc2JdxdLW5Ybr9c8cTQF1W1FDdL927hqySVLhQjG65cV2gW4n5BXH1LT0QBW5qx1jj2xN5cXW7VQZw-1R-t4gW73rcwf1B6PbrW81R3YV52ryN-W6Dgk6d7N-jjdW1zTxLd6mxM-gW8Y-FmV8bJsTyW6zCHG-6gmFjNW5ql1y53rpwZqN19PMv2YjtQ3F3n7KPSHx3pW2HJLG47f-9dfW8KMwNM526117f2N8x9v04 ) from drugs purchased on Snapchat, California courts ruled the platform itself could be sued as a defective product.
- The plaintiffs alleged (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3p0W63B68M1Lfbg7W4vb09F90qRkWW1t28MP6Thj8CW7wVfy53SB0C1W7r38Vc2JdxdLW5Ybr9c8cTQF1W1FDdL927hqySVLhQjG65cV2gW4n5BXH1LT0QBW5qx1jj2xN5cXW7VQZw-1R-t4gW73rcwf1B6PbrW81R3YV52ryN-W6Dgk6d7N-jjdW1zTxLd6mxM-gW8Y-FmV8bJsTyW6zCHG-6gmFjNW5ql1y53rpwZqN19PMv2YjtQ3F3n7KPSHx3pW2HJLG47f-9dfW8KMwNM526117f2N8x9v04 ) ‚ÄúSnapchat‚Äôs design had created an online open-air drug market,‚Äù and the courts agreed that Section 230 could not protect the app‚Äôs design; it wasn‚Äôt the content that caused the harm.

// The history of product liability

Product liability emerged around the time of mass manufacturing, making manufacturers responsible for products that were harmful or defective. A case in the 1940s involving an exploding Coca-Cola bottle (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRb2-6q8W7Y8-PT6lZ3l1N8sntjxS0WnVW3mWZ5W6-c6KlW4sHT5v4vpgFhW7txb8j4kWQ0SW9634ZL8pCndZN4w_JQ2gLQMPMlMyBFdC69nW71Vh_b3MJ1FqW2qhTyR5xTztQW7hTxqW1y60hjW7Qb0NT2Ryg0gW760qFd7tTZ4kW1G4PNt7RQ6TxVJxGt82QKDr5W9c-Bpf2sLvX6F1y3jHkl-z0W4Xv94m8_5c2_W1mjWt75zcK7YW41ccTV5gCHF-W2KF9LL5kw7v3W8T47Zr30YVfPW6FT-1f5pGPJbW2yFs7l13Kr_9W1Dw9Sm8ZpllzW5vQh2q2FVD2SW3f_qf12SZjS4f92kwcb04 ) contributed to the establishment of this precedent. This same precedent was applied to Big Tobacco when they failed to give consumers fair warning that cigarettes were addictive and, in the long term, harmful.

If the legal cases succeed, they could open the floodgates for liability beyond Section 230, forcing mandatory design changes, cigarette-pack-style warning labels (as the former U.S. Surgeon General has endorsed (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3lJVkDRnb5FXtF5W1yqB4V6469k4W3GgjRm5fy9b0N8qmHVz59cj4N2_bN0vy_z1CW2VH-tJ8_YBhbW16DDjL8pKh7cN2ZXt6QqnFXPN7JWjngB3FpSW62N1dp1G3sCyVgQnQ86XmKcwW7gvHl_4DMsykW4M9-LG1yz4Q3W8_94gt4PdcTpW3G92896ZZ4fdW3fDKrC9lxPQ_VsB2fv4H1kqRW22fNNc5bkC-hW3RhLg46CP1H6W5p4fdd9j5QqZVqYj161pFdf4W2kW3WH7cFZmKf65w41F04 ) ), stronger age restrictions, bans for certain features, and financial damages.

Big Tech can afford to pay these fines (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHW5n2LPp4J-x8NV1J0Lf8N06yKV-7mlD30Y62wW58Dn0T5S-1BXW69wnmD4Y58j6W22c-Sj6jQt7CW6Yhfgw8zqfvpW8dkPw07hQhmRVlhsww2FZV92W8qjNlj3L92FyW7NMyYh4YDfKJN5vrDbr2t3M0W7G-8rr5ZMQFYW1b2XBs6Q-HbcW52rXZx3tv6bnW8-8hWc89D5PL22W2 ) (as it has in the past with E.U. fines), but it‚Äôs not so much about the money as about the legal precedent. If Big Tech‚Äôs products are deemed to be defective, it could have profound implications for the design of social media as a whole. According to Santa Clara University law professor Eric Goldman (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3k-W2yckNj2VXTYjVNXB-q6-_nPNW58QKf81PJKvxW8q-1hv8hZPg0W8p0x3C1P5M-sVKkytH8FRQcXW6bTKTK1VrVYgW4hdFzj62P-F1W8GQcNl2R0zcwW8-1Y1w4zlP2JW3vMW3G6Yvt71Vt_8r88498mRW7d4r2p3VtFr2W3ctLMH6JMw3LW2Y-7K15NyNlrW8nKD-m7TqM4zW8WsQ5H2P0B9HW5xfS5S3lxFdSW6nxw8g4bWcXsW3K-wCX5C7R9CW3mqfCg4QdrWgN4jlqMTv9ZF9f84BL2W04 ) , ‚ÄúIf the plaintiffs win, the internet will almost certainly look different than it does today.‚Äù

// Regulation vs. Litigation

The U.S. has no federal regulation of social media and instead has enacted a patchwork of state policies. In 2025, multiple states proposed bans or restrictions on social media for minors (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQW2-6q8W7lCdLW6lZ3l2W8C61DG27MQlnW6snHyJ79QxSVW6zjTNX2DRgy5W6wDfY98rRf-FN5STqw0rwx0YW3p-GQb3_G9bMN4P05snSmGVYW1CYDsP1xFpr7W7y-rHV7x2bcvW6Wxr1v78GxsTW90zCMc7k9DKSW78lB327V9HDNW411sgg8rkxbYW6z62YX81WgSVN51JwMVMxwGNW1vdhjV50RYktW82tv05158v2pW4Y3nqj1ZYDPpW5c1GhQ8xG5F7W54G8LL7Q3LrZW7wqyBX5HCp84W85Js7v2Tmks5W4D70Qj3jS3C3N8_mtdrXr94_f23GsRC04 ) , but courts struck down the measures on First Amendment grounds. With platforms protected from content liability under Section 230, the lack of regulation makes litigation one preferred approach in the U.S.

This differs from what‚Äôs happening in Europe (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRP2-6q8W95jsWP6lZ3pBW2ttkHF2ZgxhrW7Y8_R884FBZTW63N4Jj3MdcFlW7NQw798h7ZpHF7pJBr7z1h2W2s1FNn5-WQRSW1VMcwl8K0TfMW2cVnYF5PbxYHW4dmfLl6Hr62DW7ZwhrP7ssDZCW5jqK2J3jGxNyN5P60-T_THYWW1jG4yQ156M82W8McMSg3gbyrgW4wRZhw1RDMPNW3dJhZ216JwhxW1WvqmD4Yz1t6W1XpXH-4yXtT7W9dtDv68dC7fWW7KjsYM4jRm83W43tvlJ6x1NnpW37yrG23cML53W6fBWZd5Yf9TRN2jwxJKKJzy1VQ8HBw1BbtVNN2bch2d7xsTLW5cjy133fJpBWVDxSjv7rB7McN6LkCZ7Z6RsbW7w05hK900nWLf8JBJz004 ) , where there‚Äôs a stronger political will to pass Eurozone tech policy. In Europe, the DSA restricts targeted ads to minors and requires large platforms to assess and mitigate systemic risks‚Äîincluding risks to minors‚Äîbacked by enforcement actions that increasingly scrutinize addictive design. As we explored in a recent newsletter, policymakers in Europe and elsewhere are considering whether to follow Australia‚Äôs lead (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRP2-6q8W95jsWP6lZ3njW97jmHY74nvMWW3xZWpZ52QTqhW6CkC-Q74P8z_W2sFNLr6mvVfvW744hXk3p4Ct2W4w7LVJ1SgYDWW54yCjp3MJ5l1W4cHcvG85J4RwW8-7GYt7Nq4tjW3Qn7_78T8XnYW1WpvF08ZsBrsW6jPqs13W4BN7W1dWKcg1tXSn-W8nstDZ40XY7yW5zVr7G58VmM-W1HQ19N5Q2xjDW5yVXfd5_KmHGW68BVfr3qvPvkW6-zRgg627_qNW92h2b44tdPY0W5CxbTF64rDydW8-rhhC36D7ttW1jHxx91fW6gPW5bBBLG3TrfvYW4ZK3pF1DBVKgW8Kbj3s1lRL1XW4R2tkc2QT6SfW3vNMfR7_b847VwLnhH7tncLVVBpX5B4-_HnLf66L2x804 ) and ban social media for users under 16.

// A turning point for Big Tech

The lawsuits in California raise broader questions about tech policy strategy: Is reactive litigation an effective way to hold tech accountable? And how can litigation post-harm translate into proactive legislation that prevents harm before it occurs?

The lawsuits are also part of a larger push to hold Big Tech accountable. Antitrust cases are advancing (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQW2-6q8W7lCdLW6lZ3mnW7h63ct1fFnW9W4S69cZ7Z0s3VW82D_T97XGtH8W3PwCqD3CFgwsW820cq41swPcSVMTMsD2svKMFW8F-0wq1rrz5GW1mMctZ2S2pB5W7-JHmX1mY-pRN5jMyMbpr7syW7Qbst23FKMw4VCD0kN3JjcZyW5ryTgG6gHT6WW1dNGml3Gz__JW6xKX2Y3ZcfWZW92HWyg16_Z0WN43srz3c8jYgW2d1w_G6bk3CtW8WYKLt1fQYL2W1WglTy2XZCM4W19KhHL6vkSJMW17yBxg2bjtxjW4WknjR17-3sZN49KvnBRzk6Vf3bWh8-04 ) against Google, Meta, Amazon, and Apple. States have passed their own laws (see Utah‚Äôs Digital Choice Act (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQ02-6q8W5BW0B06lZ3mSW237jZd22tzYFW1j59hp8Rv4-sW3g31rq98BGfxW7R_j0y463zylW4tp1gb2lwTdtW52HVB-2XTw0mW3gC8LR6nL5-qW5MTt8k8R-sDNW89zkxH4zHFx7V7rhQd13NcHKW6hWtTH5-Z3dsW1t07Nt8xL6f5W7CDP3d7B_RqkW75brnQ6nJ87KW8xQV5q4L1ylXW7H02DQ2VMNJwW7Kf2yf166NRnVsBkX_2gM_-mf7L1-7g04 ) ). Grassroots organizations like ParentsTogether (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHW5n2LPp4J-x8NV1J0Lf8MxhWsW4ng-Z282D8WyW1d-XL110r0DKVV6_6-4F74h6W5N2-TB7LZZpqW8SQkp97sgjqZW4yY9Wg8P4ZLWW5LZgqj1hKHDTVwKyW128s7ncVjw4816jbbsQW5mBX4v1p1CVTV7t9Xd1HVZBJW6HNFvB3C9xHWW2FMFRx8SMWyzN800BpNcpQPD112 ) , Design It For Us (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHW5n2LPp4J-x8NV1J0Lf8M2PxlN2Sj-4nlJ2McN34yg_QX7LQbW869V4G4K4kgCW1wXBTc1rLVP1W4d9n2w3ZLj0rW49J0zQ6pwhDXW3H_8dn7-lFWrW72b57p6kFhNXW8F835j1t8GyJW6jcGxQ7JdQXfW62-j4B1WfdmKW3_LJv-4xyS2CW1-_W-13LDn_2W84n8nQ6F8V7p24w2 ) , and the Social Media Victims Law Center (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHW5n2LPp4J-x8NV1J0Lf8NcpT4VHXNxg7VCL0JW5Bh2wl8sy77HW9h8ms27hBx6GW5hVVmJ3sdbBxMrZK2wMd8L8W6m37z216ws1_W2tY0_H3xgK8vW6sPScz8TdzhMW5Cq4RG2gnLsHW6bMhbw4bVhNxW3vW7HP1F-s2mW4svDTy3VV6ZtW91NsJp94yWXyW8Wkynm69XV0y23Z2 ) are mobilizing families and pushing for legislative action.

The pattern remains: A billion-dollar industry denies the addictive nature of its product, but internal documents show otherwise. It goes to litigation because there aren‚Äôt any regulations in place to protect consumers.

If these trials favor product liability, the implications for platform design and Big Tech accountability are staggering. Section 230 shields platforms from user-generated content, but content isn't the issue when deliberately addictive design decisions are causing known harm. The verdicts will determine if we‚Äôve entered the era of Big Tech‚Äôs accountability reckoning, with a jury deciding whether social media is, in fact, a drug.

// üö´ An article in Politico (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQ02-6q8W5BW0B06lZ3mKW3KWNhY2S3ytVN4LlgtVd5Q2DW7sqpdZ3qvD-GW86w3SP8fn9stW2lv2Vf8TwMH0W45s6l95GMtN2W6XMvRD3PZbZ_W9jg4wS5xC66RW3-QPxK4sHF3nW8p4DRY4cP9qXW73cccS2zppSLW6WsSJ74TpT7zW22cJpq7fhHh_W8ty6gn2SX0DNW3kg5ZW1T3YRlW71NJtc3pwVzcW8-nCdD4PyrgXW3959tb6nSCVpf38857Y04 ) reported on warnings from experts that AI chatbots are not your friends. (Free).

// üåê There is a volunteer Wikipedia army protecting against AI slop. The editors are both populating and fighting the world‚Äôs regional language AI engines, according to an article in Rest of World (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQj2-6q8W69sMD-6lZ3nQW6QF-dv2hKDWfW2jKQVS2Z6yvcW6qxb9R7ZB7MZW9ccKll3Gq3NdW6VjdPw2V0L54W8GSJcH6Kkf0_W4t_dQY1nJ0s-N2r8yJh3cVwkW3YKltg8ftr2GW2kFk-J2RSZ--W2fkSl52gfx_JW89MtW83zG_YtW4WL-h75pXnbBN5vQS_FGnXVTW2TRDGf60x2kyW3ZqsxM6_hSL9N9gDhSmv-h9RW45Rgft3fkGNdW6gRh292LRtDwW86GXl96XTnnTdQXK8W04 ) . (Free).

// üìÑ An article in Tech Policy Press (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQC2-6q8W6N1vHY6lZ3mxW5fp7FP7SSSpfW5dYtnf32x3FKW1b9H_17XgSqsN8DM1HGHPRHzW8MvJJf4G6P9xW7mSYZp3nTbXfW8wsw5z550l4LW6YyplH7r_V1NW7f6hyP76yFZgW6Qt3m-8mTsLnW9h2fwY8R6jZnW5WR7NW7fd_gWN4r-NwsJ1KknW41sNzx5RmH0HW7L6p_g7Ns5nxW8ykLql2MxpYKW1wKkwG5BFqt7N1YvjtNVqvY0W26cRyz5Q0-tBW2-9Fbf5-tT3PW2_VJ-05scNvRW6ZVPwQ7H_p1hf6BvHLq04 ) makes the case that courts are missing the fair use argument in the copyright battle over AI summaries. (Free).

// üéô On his podcast (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQj2-6q8W69sMD-6lZ3lZN6_gRPdDQM59W56RPq46w-04FW5Wt3vl8yn4P4W7hP16G3MVjqtW2p5dt112rr9XW45lb301nXPvsN8Z9ZMcs0qk9N4R8zkZjtvcbVZTT6C1rChhlW2jR5CL525ZBkW1nw6Db6V8113W5FF7Ff2F2XqLW6jBrRC8Srl_sW7QsLWn6Qx_q5W7fMFdD8JhpQRW2PMmFn1mBS7LW5t1HNr7gXxvgN6dvC10MGWFGW95MpCc88G9yxVgLG6G7lwLzPf1wBQn404 ) , New York Times journalist Ezra Klein interviewed Cory Doctorow and Tim Wu to explore the state of today‚Äôs internet. It‚Äôs not one we asked for. (Free).

// üñ• AI is not the only threat menacing big tech. An article in The Economist (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LQW2-6q8W7lCdLW6lZ3nlW5LLQgh5XbvYtW5wJp1K3XnlwDW5N28P37N3pQJW2QVFF72hb4jyW4MXL7B8mjSGvW33kkBD826v9QW2r3lpF4srClrMy3m1Sh8_spW2G_z_g6KZFVfW6TFDYr399SnKVGzj7d3GCwb4N75qY8dcH_SjW4-XL3w6MsKCkVx7JKQ45RJN-W4XdNfw922pkJVTfpQd8Ld7MmN2X1JmLSdQdGVZq8ks74v65hW2rL-037d_gyDW8y764n3WN3YKW17ZKSQ76BFH1W29qs-817f-5cW7KYR2-3TQfnlVzl8C97X02q8f6rxBBb04 ) asks, are Meta and Google ads recession-proof? Partner news

// Engaging Generative AI Beyond the Hype

February 19 | 1PM ET | Virtual

All Tech Is Human (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHW5n2LPp4J-x8NV1J0Lf8MSTJgW20N2Gx3PcJJ0W5tN0lz5cPR2-W1cTVRs1CQwZmW9c_nnx76Z_S4W4KSD7t2_1cDcW4Hydm46zmlyjW5RGW-M3620ScW2fm49c2k0Hr2N96TX7dDbH8DW62cJVt7BP6pfW15h19b3zsXBBW872vy022wGKtW1GtW6D3xZmjyW89xz5k8d-0KK2332 ) is hosting a livestream conversation on how to engage with generative AI. Authors Maggie Engler (Microsoft AI) and Numa Dhamani (iVerify) will explore what‚Äôs changed in areas like AI agents, safety, labor, and governance, and how people can consider risks, responsibilities, and real-world impact. Register here (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LRv2-6q8W8wLKSR6lZ3nDW3vx1TD5hQj92W5XF0Ld64b5ZnW8g10VX9g4N-CW1kxV7R5_vHlFW5dW2R01XkRMxVBd8r512L6Z3N5jMjCvfdK3HW1-qGPf1qhKtCVHYcht85LZT6W8HyVkh85_ghRW9fMljk70fGrYW9cTrSx3ZxfhmN7fR0vNJJJ06W6Lxb589b-8ndW6rshwd1cmB5gW6Cb6xX7sr8skW33xN6P6Nl9MWW214J-v241FLxW2SY-6H3Yzz0vW8wF_mY3RwzvdVDCKgv8L87t1N6Z2FNxKy4GpW7z0Qdj56B4s4W9cDjPm6VMhJfW6bxvJ27_cXJZW55fR9-8mQVs_W6rk2Q22LgmPNW3HJWNF16Kxryd7tV8R04 ) .

// Humanity & AI at Davos

At the 2026 World Economic Forum, Future of Life Institute (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHW5n2LPp4J-x8NV1J0Lf8NgsYJVvr4kg3SyTdzW5vf_MQ8KFgwxW3ZmxKt8kV2StW64yvvM7nQ9CsVVYJf23gVvB2W2007g81lvW8dW4PQ3Q263F9nsW4-blww6fsK70W7bk-ym6_grH6W37ShSt7m-kwVW3Xf9R17qSXh5W3zTz-f1-gv8JN1MmcK26xXxqW7lWzJQ3gV4qc1b2 ) President Max Tegmark joined author Yuval Noah Harari for a conversation exploring the future of humanity, the governance of advanced AI systems, and how human agency can be preserved as technology reshapes global society. Watch the discussion here (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHN5n2LPK2-6q8W50kgx26lZ3lTN2MbY8_qKn9cW65Bl3R55ty-2W6dZhW-4xcJZ-W3K5q9X2_lhM3W2MtlrS74BHZlW3_hmTM4jJxmrMGTcJ7Hvf8vW6vMh3-5tD6HLN80rwQn6xP4CW3YlT6J4SdJBCW6BWBpX3DTfJNVyytDx91jbYKVnP54p86RpZxW59C9KF10HnwvN55VGjKCdkHQW77XqbT1lYGB_f7Hf0ZK04 ) .

// The 2025 Global Dialogues Index Report

The Collective Intelligence Project (https://email.projectliberty.io/e3t/Ctc/RI+113/cZ5Fl04/VWlBhd5H5sFFW4l64dR8pdCRlW5r_q0D5KmkNHW5n2LP54J-x8tV1J0Lf8M_0PkW7hKvzp2dMvBTVgyTRx9jDd1WMxfgQD4ffC3W1Nth8972hRw6W59jQ9j8YfSyVW3b3td161CPDKW4PZzZT1_S9j6W1cG3073_-1hgW2txqkD7v_RgvW5FZlmQ44NpZRW3n5m1h61pjdXW6fGFLV371H782152 ) shared findings from a year of global dialogue about how the world lives with AI in its report: The 2025 Global Dialogues Index Report.
